ticket.title: has_one :through with :autosave (unknown key: autosave)
ticket.original-body: Hey, im not quite sure if this is even supposed to work, but in the rails rdocs, it's not mentioned that you cannot use :autosave with :through. anyway, my original problem was, that my has_one :through asssociation is always beeing saved (although the docs say, only saves if new_record?), which i don't want, so i thought setting :autosave to false should do the trick, but has_one doesn't accept the autosave key, when :through is specified.
ticket.latest-body: Hey, im not quite sure if this is even supposed to work, but in the rails rdocs, it's not mentioned that you cannot use :autosave with :through. anyway, my original problem was, that my has_one :through asssociation is always beeing saved (although the docs say, only saves if new_record?), which i don't want, so i thought setting :autosave to false should do the trick, but has_one doesn't accept the autosave key, when :through is specified.
ticket.original-body-html:
Hey,
im not quite sure if this is even supposed to work, but in the rails rdocs, it's not mentioned that you cannot use :autosave with :through. anyway, my original problem was, that my has_one :through asssociation is always beeing saved (although the docs say, only saves if new_record?), which i don't want, so i thought setting :autosave to false should do the trick, but has_one doesn't accept the autosave key, when :through is specified.

Hey,
im not quite sure if this is even supposed to work, but in the rails rdocs, it's not mentioned that you cannot use :autosave with :through. anyway, my original problem was, that my has_one :through asssociation is always beeing saved (although the docs say, only saves if new_record?), which i don't want, so i thought setting :autosave to false should do the trick, but has_one doesn't accept the autosave key, when :through is specified.

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
